intro: Maburea trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined maburea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features small, elliptical leaves with three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
